text: Madurai Kamaraj University (MKU) is a public university in Madurai city in southern Tamil Nadu, India. It was established in 1966 and has about 130,000 students in 18 schools comprising 72 departments and 109 affiliated colleges. ==History== Madurai Kamaraj University was inaugurated on 6 February 1966, based on the extension centre of the University of Madras, at Madurai. In 1968, the foundation stone for a new campus was laid by Zakir Hussain, the then President of India. The Directorate of Distance Education of the university was established in 1971. In 1978, the name was changed to Madurai Kamaraj University to honour K. Kamaraj, former Chief Minister of Madras State. == Campus == The Madurai Kamaraj University campus is located at Palkalai Nagar in the Madurai to Theni High road. The university campus is located 13 km away from the Periyar Bus-stand and Railway station, 18 km away from the Integrated Bus-stand Mattuthavani. Buses are frequently available from Periyar Bus-stand. == Hostel == The university campus has five hostels for men and three hostels for women which accommodates post graduate students, M.Phil Students and Research Scholars.
